repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Mekong Transport and Flood
            Protection Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Mekong Transport and
            Flood Protection Project for Vietnam were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was moderate; Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: further
            engagement between the Bank and government on how best to
            support the transformation of Vietnam's road
            construction industry-from a sector dominated by state-owned
            enterprises to a competitive and efficient market-must look
            beyond the issue of procurement eligibility under a
            stand-alone investment project. Measures to strengthen both
            contract management and project management remain an
            immediate need. Better management of capital resources can
            improve implementation efficiency and reduce delays.

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Additional Financing and
            Restructuring of the Mekong Transport and Flood Protection Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The closing date for Vietnam, Mekong
            Transport and Flood Protection Project will be extended from
            December 31, 2010 until June 30, 2011. The extension for a
            6-month period beyond the closing date is necessary to
            complete on-going activities. The main activities to be
            supported by the extension are: (i) four (04) on-going works
            contracts totaling 28km; (ii) two (02) on-going works
            contracts for black spot improvement; (iii) consultancy
            services for a feasibility study for future project; and
            (iv) detailed design consultancy services for remained 30km
            of roads. This will be the third extension of the original
            project - Mekong Transport and Flood Protection Project
            since the original closing date of June 30, 2006 and will be
            the first extension of the additional financing since the
            original closing date of December 31, 2010.

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Mekong Transport and Flood
            Protection Project : second order restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The second order restructuring of the
            Mekong Transport and Flood Protection Project of Vietnam
            seeks the approval of the Regional Vice President for
            amendments to the Development Credit Agreement (DCA) for:
            (i) financing the construction of additional bridges; (ii) a
            reallocation of Credit proceeds; and (iii) an extension of
            closing date to December 31, 2010. The reallocation will
            meet the financial needs of the project. The extension
            enables completion of the activities identified in the
            amendment and reallocation. The rationale for these
            modifications was discussed with the Borrower during the
            negotiations of the Additional Financing package. The
            amendments are consistent with the original development
            objectives and project design, do not require changes to the
            key performance indicators, and are expected to strengthen
            the associated outcomes.

Vietnam - Mekong Transport and Flood
            Protection Project : second order restructuring

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Mekong Transport and Flood
            Protection Project : resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Mekong Transport and Flood
            Protection Project involves rehabilitation of the road
            sections including widening and raising of road embankment,
            pavement, culverts, and bridges; construction of bypasses,
            etc. The project will require the acquisition of land
            located in the project corridor for road construction and
            relocation sites. A detailed measurement survey (DMS) and
            census and a socio-economic survey were conducted on the
            project affected persons (PAPs). In the Can Tho - Nam Can
            Section, there are 10,970 project affected households
            (PAHs), 4 percent will suffer from a loss of agricultural
            land and 81 percent from loss of residential land. 7,844
            PAPs will be affected by loss of structures and 4,469 PAPs
            will be relocated. In the flooded section of Dong Ha - Quang
            Ngai, 3,582 PAPs are affected, mostly by loss of
            agricultural land. The resettlement action plan (RAP) aims
            to minimize adverse impacts of the project; improve, or at
            least restore, incomes, living standards, and productive
            capacity of PAPs; provide compensation at replacement costs;
            and implement the plan with full participation of and
            consultation with PAHs. Some of the PAPs who were affected
            by loss of structures were in fact illegal owners of the
            structures. The RAP provides detailed specification of the
            eligibility of compensation.

docna.cdata!:
The 06 bridges between Dam Chung and Nam Cam
            - resettlement action plan

            PAPs will be affected by loss of structures and 4,469 PAPs
            will be relocated. In the flooded section of Dong Ha - Quang
            Ngai, 3,582 PAPs are affected, mostly by loss of
            agricultural land. The resettlement action plan (RAP) aims
            to minimize adverse impacts of the project; improve, or at
            least restore, incomes, living standards, and productive
            capacity of PAPs; provide compensation at replacement costs;
            and implement the plan with full participation of and
            consultation with PAHs. Some of the PAPs who were affected
            by loss of structures were in fact illegal owners of the
            structures. The RAP provides detailed specification of the
            eligibility of compensation.

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Additional Financing and
            Restructuring of the Mekong Transport and Flood Protection Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The closing date for Vietnam, Mekong
            Transport and Flood Protection Project will be extended from
            December 31, 2010 until June 30, 2011. The extension for a
            6-month period beyond the closing date is necessary to
            complete on-going activities. The main activities to be
            supported by the extension are: (i) four (04) on-going works
            contracts totaling 28km; (ii) two (02) on-going works
            contracts for black spot improvement; (iii) consultancy
            services for a feasibility study for future project; and
            (iv) detailed design consultancy services for remained 30km
            of roads. This will be the third extension of the original
            project - Mekong Transport and Flood Protection Project
            since the original closing date of June 30, 2006 and will be
            the first extension of the additional financing since the
            original closing date of December 31, 2010.

display_title.display_title:
Vietnam - Additional Financing
            and Restructuring of the Mekong Transport and Flood
            Protection Project : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Mekong Transport and Flood
            Protection Project : additional financing

abstracts.cdata!:
This Project Paper seeks the approval of
            the Executive Directors to provide an Additional Finance to
            Socialist Republic of Vietnam for the Mekong Transport and
            Flood Protection Project. The additional financing would
            enable the project to: (i) meet the original project
            objectives by completing the remaining 58 km of road
            rehabilitation works under the Mekong Delta Network
            Improvement (MDNI) sub-component; and (ii) finance expanded
            activities to enhance the project's development impact
            by constructing the Ganh Hao II (GH2) Bridge located in
            Ca-Mau city, which connects road sections of the on-going
            IDA-financed investments on National Highway 1 (NH1) under
            the existing project. These activities are consistent with
            the project development objectives, though the GH2 Bridge is
            additional to the scope of works in the original project.
